DOC.brief_summary: The investigator study test model contraceptive care develop part Contraceptive CHOICE Project . CHOICE prospective cohort study 9,256 woman design : 1 ) promote use long-acting reversible contraceptive ( LARC ) method include interuterine device ( IUD ) subdermal implant ; 2 ) remove financial barrier contraception ; 3 ) evaluate continuation satisfaction reversible method ; 4 ) reduce unintended pregnancy St. Louis region . CHOICE demonstrate intervention comprehensive contraceptive counseling , increase access , removal financial barrier increase uptake LARC method reduce unintended pregnancy . The investigator objective determine whether CHOICE model contraceptive care equally successful real world community clinic .
DOC.detailed_description: This project involve compare two model contraceptive care ; 'enhanced care ' usual care plus CHOICE contraceptive counseling , 'complete CHOICE model ' include contraceptive counseling well provider train cost support IUDs implant . Participants enrol three partner community clinic staff member ( site coordinator ) dedicate research study . All participant undergo contraceptive counseling well baseline survey coordinator . Participants complete telephone survey 3 , 6 , 12 month post-enrollment ask contraceptive method chosen , satisfaction continuation method , pregnancy experience since enrollment .
DOC.criteria: 1 . 1445 year age 2 . Does desire pregnancy next 12 month 3 . Desires reversible contraception 4 . Sexually active man within past 6 month intend sex man next 3 month 5 . Willing able undergo inform consent 6 . Willing comply study protocol 1year followup schedule 7 . Not currently pregnant 8 . Current patient Family Care Carondelet , Family Care Forest Park Southeast , Memphis Health Center 1 . Has undergone female sterilization procedure tubal ligation hysterectomy 2 . Has one sexual partner undergone vasectomy procedure 3 . Speaks language English Spanish 4 . Currently use IUD implant contraceptive method
